result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven M Binet was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Defendant is to serve thirty (30) days in County Jail with Huber privileges CONSECUTIVE to sentence currently serving.  Defendant may serve jail time in Walworth, Kenosha, or Racine counties. The defendant is to report on time and with no detectable amount of alcohol, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Failure to comply will result in revocation of Huber privileges for a period of five (5) days unless reinstated by the Court.
---------------------
IT IS HEREBY Ordered that the defendant's excess Huber funds be applied toward all restitution and outstanding fines/costs while serving his/her mandatory jail sentence. 
---------------------

Pay court costs. Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
COC COLLECT 
-------------------
Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH C.A.M. (dob 6/3/1996) OR RESIDENCE OR J.T.H. (dob 1/30/1995) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
